The Shade is a monster located at the entrance to the last level of the Stronghold of Security.

Shades may be assigned as a Slayer task by Mazchna. In addition to 'Shades' themselves, Loar Shades, Phrin Shades, Riyl Shade, Asyn Shades, and Fiyr Shades, which can be found in Mort'ton or the nearby Shade Catacombs can also be slain to fulfil the task. To access the shade catacombs, players must have completed the Shades of Mort'ton quest.

Additional damage can be done to shades through the use of Salve amulets or the Gadderhammer weapon.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 2,287 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

Main drops[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Shade robe (top)18/1282424
Shade robe (bottom)18/1281818

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable
Mimic kill token (m)11/10,00095,216Not alchemisable

Random event (discontinued)[edit | edit source]

When a player buried bones, they had a possibility of angering an aggressive Shade who would appear and attack them. Shades were transparent in appearance and looked somewhat like a ghost. As with similar guardian random events, the combat level of a shade varied according to the combat level of the player unfortunate enough to run into one. When slain, the shade usually dropped nothing, but sometimes it would drop an assortment of bones, and on rare occasions, shade robes. Originally, shades were able to close or open a door without standing beside it, which was unique among all free monsters, but this feature was removed.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Guardian of the Realm ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Asgarnia & Misthalin.
    • Shade robe top and bottom drops

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
  • patch 19 June 2017 (Update):
    • Shades will now spawn correctly in the Player-Owned Slayer Dungeon.
  • patch 22 November 2012 (Update):
    • Attacking Shades now gives the correct amount of XP and hit harder.
  • patch 9 June 2009 (Update):
    • Clarified the location of the Shades when talked about by the Slayer Masters.
  • patch 6 May 2009 (Update):
    • Shades in the Stronghold of Security have had their robes adjusted to better match the dropped version.
  • hidden 25 February 2009 (Update):
    • Shades have been added to the 4th level of the Stronghold of Security.
  • update 2 February 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Before Evolution of Combat, it was not very wise to train on shades, because no matter how much damage you inflicted on them, you only received a quarter of the normal experience per hit and only 5% normal slayer experience.
  • These were the fourth highest level free-to-play monsters, being tied with Cockroach soldiers. Many higher level monsters have since been made f2p, and now there are at least 30 different f2p monsters with a higher level.
  • Although Shades are transparent, Shade robes are not.
  • Shades have the old idle and walking animations that were used on players before RuneScape High Detail.
  • Shades' attack animation is that of slashing a sword, as is their blocking animation. However, they hold no sword at all.
